definitions.definition: To extort money or favors from (a person) by exciting fears of injury other than bodily harm, such as injury to reputation, distress of mind, false accusation, etc.
examples: He blackmailed a businesswoman by threatening to expose an alleged fraud.

definitions.definition: To speak ill of someone; to defame someone.

main_definition: ( transitive ) To extort money or favors from (a person) by exciting fears of injury other than bodily harm, such as injury to reputation, distress of mind, false accusation, etc.
secondary_definitions: ( Kenya ) To speak ill of someone; to defame someone.
